choices.B: Grant access to all users and then remove the entity from the sitemap and advanced find. Provide users who need access a direct link to a view of the entity.
choices.C: Grant the appropriate security roles user-level access to the custom entity.
choices.A: Ask a system administrator to share the records with the users who need access.
choices.D: Grant the appropriate security roles organization-level access to the custom entity.

questions.question_text:
You create an organization-owned custom entity.
You need to ensure that users can see the custom entity while minimizing the permissions that you grant users.
What should you do?

discussion.content: Correct answer is D. Organization owned entities only have None and Organization levels in security roles.
I'll be picking D when I take the exam
Answer should be *D
Correct
correct

questions.question_text:
You add a new entity named Parts to Microsoft Dynamics 365.
You need to grant all users that have the Salesperson security role read access to the Parts entity.
Which tab of the Security Role page should you use?

choices.A: a many-to-many (N:N) relationship from the contact to the country
choices.C: a many-to-many (N:N) relationship from the contact to the country that has a relationship behavior type of Parental
choices.B: a one-to-many (1:N) relationship from the country to the contact
choices.D: a one-to-many (1:N) relationship from the contact to the country

questions.question_text:
You plan to create a country entity that contains one record for each country in the world.
You need to track which countries a contact visited. No additional data will be tracked.
Which type of relationship should you create?

discussion.content: Answer should be A. As one country can be associated with multiple contacts and one contact can have multiple countries.
Should be A?
Correct answer is: A
For me the correct answer is A: n:n

comments.content: 1:N would mean, that each country can be associated with one contact only - so D is wrong. It is A.

discussion.content:
One contact record could have multiple countries, but not more than one of the same country (1:N) accordingly, each country would also only be associated with a contact once (1:N). 

If there was N:N that would mean that a contact could be associated with the same country many times and visa versa, but the scenario isn't asking for this. It asks for the countries visited, not the number of times a country is visited. D is correct.

comments.content: nope, forget that comment, it is N:N!

discussion.content: The answer is correct, it's D. A one-to-many relationship doesn't mean that records on the "many" side can be used only once. A many-to-many relationship would also work but isn't necessary because, as someone else said, you don't need to see the Contacts against the Country
If you need to use the country more than once, it has to be a N:N relationship. Otherwise, the country can only be selected once.

comments.content: If you do this, a country can be visited only by 1 contact. Answer should be A

discussion.content: Actually they ask only to see which countries a contact been visiting. Not which contacts that visited a country.
Answer should be A

choices.B: Adjust accent colors including hover and selection colors.
choices.A: Export a theme as part of a solution.
choices.C: Change the logo and navigation colors.

discussion.content: Correct answer is: BCE

Poorly worded. Default Entity color and Default Custom Entity color are part of a theme, so yes colors can specifically applied to entities (among other elements), just not individual entities. BCE is correct.
How can settings in 'Themes' set entity specific colouring when they set the themes system/environment wide? (where is there an option there to select an entity and then the colour scheme for it?)
Change icon colors is done through the solution on the entity. Therefore, BCE should be the right answer.
BCE is the answer.
BCE is correct.

I guess it should be BCE
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-engagement/customize/change-color-scheme-add-logo-match-organizations-brand

questions.question_text:
You need to use Theme settings to customize the Microsoft Dynamics 365 user interface for a customer.
Which three actions can you perform? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
